tool_description: Guides proper water sample collection procedures for different water sources, ensuring representative samples for testing while maintaining sterility and chain of custody.

water_source_type.description: Type of water source being sampled: well, stream, lake, tap, spring, rainwater, or other

sample_volume_ml.description: Required sample volume in milliliters (minimum 100ml, maximum 5000ml)

collection_depth_cm.description: Depth below surface to collect sample in centimeters

sterilization_method.description: Container sterilization method: flame, alcohol, bleach, or boiling

preservation_required.description: Whether sample needs chemical preservation for transport

error_messages: Invalid water source type: Must be one of [well, stream, lake, tap, spring, rainwater, other]
Sample volume out of range: Volume must be between 100ml and 5000ml
Invalid sterilization method: Must be one of [flame, alcohol, bleach, boiling]
Collection depth inappropriate: Depth must be positive for surface water, zero for tap water
Preservation method conflict: Some tests require unpreserved samples
usage: Specify water source type and required sample volume. Optionally set collection depth, sterilization method, and preservation needs. Follow the returned procedure exactly to ensure valid samples.
